vocabularies.define: the act of obeying a law or rule, especially one that controls a particular industry or type of work
vocabularies.example: The company ensures compliance with safety regulations.

vocabularies.define: a shortened form of a word or group of words, with the omitted letters often replaced in written English by an apostrophe
vocabularies.vietnames: sự co lại; dạng rút gọn
vocabularies.example: ‘Don't’ is a contraction of ‘do not’.

vocabularies.define: a book that explains how to prepare particular dishes
vocabularies.example: She bought a new cookbook to try out different recipes.

vocabularies.define: a bag made of cloth, plastic, or leather that is filled with soft material, often has an attractive cover, and is used especially on chairs for sitting or leaning on
vocabularies.example: She placed a cushion on the chair for added comfort.

vocabularies.define: a measured amount of something such as medicine
vocabularies.example: Take one dose of the medicine every six hours.

vocabularies.define: a musical instrument, especially one made from a skin stretched over the end of a hollow tube or bowl, played by hitting with the hand or a stick
vocabularies.example: He played the drum in the school band.

vocabularies.define: to fix something firmly into a substance
vocabularies.example: The journalist embedded the video into the article.

vocabularies.define: to move people from a dangerous place to somewhere safe
vocabularies.example: Residents were evacuated due to the approaching hurricane.

vocabularies.define: to make something happen more quickly
vocabularies.example: We need to expedite the processing of these documents.

vocabularies.define: a device that sprays water or chemicals to put out fires
vocabularies.example: Ensure the fire extinguisher is easily accessible.

vocabularies.define: close acquaintance with or knowledge of something
vocabularies.example: His familiarity with the software helped speed up the project.

vocabularies.define: a fault or weakness that makes something less effective or perfect
vocabularies.example: There's a flaw in your reasoning.

vocabularies.define: to change frequently in size, amount, or quality
vocabularies.example: Prices fluctuate depending on supply and demand.

vocabularies.define: able to express oneself easily and clearly, especially in a foreign language
vocabularies.example: She’s fluent in three languages.

vocabularies.define: in a truthful, sincere way
vocabularies.example: Honestly, I didn’t expect to win.

vocabularies.define: to manage the cleaning and maintenance of a house or building
vocabularies.example: She housekeeps for an elderly couple in town.

vocabularies.define: a violent storm with very strong winds and heavy rain
vocabularies.example: The hurricane caused widespread damage.

vocabularies.define: conditions and practices that help to maintain health and prevent disease
vocabularies.example: Good personal hygiene is essential for good health.

vocabularies.define: necessary and important as a part of a whole
vocabularies.example: He’s an integral part of the team.

vocabularies.define: allowing communication between people and technology
vocabularies.example: The museum has many interactive displays for children.

vocabularies.define: to get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed
vocabularies.example: I wish you wouldn’t interfere in my personal life.

vocabularies.define: a unit of mass equal to 1,000 grams
vocabularies.example: This bag of rice weighs five kilograms.

vocabularies.define: a period when someone is not working because their job has ended or been suspended
vocabularies.example: The company announced a round of layoffs.

vocabularies.define: not heavy; easy to carry or move
vocabularies.example: This jacket is warm yet lightweight.

vocabularies.define: the quality of being good, important, or useful
vocabularies.vietnames: giá trị, công lao, xứng đáng
vocabularies.example: The plan has some merit and should be considered.

vocabularies.define: a piece of jewelry worn around the neck
vocabularies.example: She wore a gold necklace to the party.

vocabularies.define: lacking the necessities of life; very poor
vocabularies.example: They donated clothes to needy families.

vocabularies.define: to pay someone too much money
vocabularies.example: You overpaid for that car.

vocabularies.define: a small booklet containing information or arguments
vocabularies.example: I picked up a pamphlet on healthy eating.

vocabularies.define: not complete or total
vocabularies.example: They only achieved partial success.

vocabularies.define: to punish someone for breaking a rule or law
vocabularies.example: The player was penalized for a foul.

vocabularies.define: to make air, water, or land dirty and not safe
vocabularies.example: Factories that pollute the environment must be controlled.

vocabularies.define: to officially tell someone to take a medicine or treatment
vocabularies.example: The doctor prescribed antibiotics for the infection.

vocabularies.define: likely to happen or be true
vocabularies.example: Rain is probable this evening.

vocabularies.define: important or well-known
vocabularies.example: She is a prominent scientist in the field.

vocabularies.define: the amount of rain that falls in a particular area
vocabularies.example: This area has high annual rainfall.

vocabularies.define: the act of moving to a new place
vocabularies.example: The company offered financial support for relocation.

vocabularies.define: a place where someone lives
vocabularies.example: They applied for permanent residence in Canada.

vocabularies.define: to get something back
vocabularies.example: The police retrieved the stolen painting.

vocabularies.define: a person who rides a bicycle, motorcycle, or horse
vocabularies.example: The rider lost control on the slippery road.

vocabularies.define: a strong elastic material made from the juice of a tropical tree
vocabularies.example: Tires are made from rubber.

vocabularies.define: a piece of thick material used on the floor
vocabularies.example: There’s a beautiful rug in the living room.

vocabularies.define: people whose job is to sell products or services
vocabularies.example: Our company trains all new salespeople thoroughly.

vocabularies.define: suddenly and by a large amount
vocabularies.example: Prices rose sharply last month.

vocabularies.define: a feature that things or people have in common
vocabularies.example: There’s a strong similarity between the two languages.

vocabularies.define: at an unknown time in the future
vocabularies.example: I hope to visit Japan someday.

vocabularies.define: someone who watches an event, especially a sports event
vocabularies.example: Thousands of spectators watched the football match.

vocabularies.define: a system for playing music that sends sound through two speakers
vocabularies.example: I bought a new stereo for my room.

vocabularies.define: a room where things are stored
vocabularies.example: The extra chairs are kept in the storeroom.

vocabularies.define: to support financially
vocabularies.example: The government subsidizes low-income housing.

vocabularies.define: believing that someone or something is wrong or dishonest
vocabularies.example: She was suspicious of his sudden generosity.

vocabularies.define: having a pleasant flavor
vocabularies.example: That was a really tasty meal!

vocabularies.define: very good or excellent
vocabularies.example: You did a terrific job!

vocabularies.define: below the surface of the ground
vocabularies.example: The parking garage is underground.

vocabularies.define: not yet paid; not receiving money
vocabularies.example: He worked as an unpaid volunteer.

vocabularies.define: the quality or state of being correct or precise
vocabularies.example: The accuracy of the report was questioned.

vocabularies.define: in any case; anyway
vocabularies.example: I didn't like it, but I bought it anyhow.

vocabularies.define: a small dish served before the main part of a meal
vocabularies.example: We had spring rolls as an appetizer.

vocabularies.define: a part of the circumference of a circle or other curve
vocabularies.example: The rainbow formed a beautiful arc across the sky.

vocabularies.define: a short performance to show the talents of someone (such as an actor or musician)
vocabularies.example: She has an audition for the lead role in the play.

vocabularies.define: a bag with shoulder straps carried on the back
vocabularies.example: He carried his books in a backpack.

vocabularies.define: a large room used for dancing
vocabularies.example: The wedding reception was held in the grand ballroom.

vocabularies.define: producing good or helpful results or effects
vocabularies.example: Regular exercise is beneficial to health.

vocabularies.define: an account of someone's life written by someone else
vocabularies.example: She wrote a biography of the famous artist.

vocabularies.define: certain or likely to happen; destined
vocabularies.example: They are bound to succeed with such a great team.

vocabularies.define: a brush with a long handle used for sweeping floors
vocabularies.example: She grabbed a broom and started sweeping.

vocabularies.define: a hamburger with a slice of cheese on it
vocabularies.example: I’d like a cheeseburger and fries, please.

vocabularies.define: unpleasantly cold
vocabularies.example: It was a chilly morning in the mountains.

vocabularies.define: a traveling show with clowns, animals, and acrobats
vocabularies.example: We took the kids to see the circus.

vocabularies.define: a polite expression of praise or admiration
vocabularies.example: She received many compliments on her outfit.

vocabularies.define: a batch of goods delivered for sale or disposal
vocabularies.example: The store received a new consignment of shoes.

vocabularies.define: relating to a continent, especially mainland Europe
vocabularies.example: He prefers a continental breakfast.

vocabularies.define: the legal right to control the use of original works
vocabularies.example: This song is protected by copyright.

vocabularies.define: land outside towns and cities, with fields and farms
vocabularies.example: They went for a walk in the countryside.

vocabularies.define: to completely destroy a building or structure
vocabularies.example: The building was demolished to make way for a mall.

vocabularies.define: relating to a department of a large organization
vocabularies.example: They held a departmental meeting every Monday.

vocabularies.define: feeling, showing, or involving a hopeless sense that a situation is so bad as to be impossible to deal with
vocabularies.example: He was desperate for a job.

vocabularies.define: to destroy or ruin something completely
vocabularies.example: The hurricane devastated the entire village.

vocabularies.define: used to identify a condition, problem, or illness
vocabularies.example: The doctor ordered diagnostic tests.

vocabularies.define: a simplified drawing showing the structure or workings of something
vocabularies.example: The teacher drew a diagram on the board.

vocabularies.define: a precious stone that is the hardest natural substance
vocabularies.example: She wore a diamond ring on her finger.

vocabularies.define: to make unable to work or function
vocabularies.vietnames: làm tê liệt, vô hiệu hóa
vocabularies.example: The virus disabled the computer system.

vocabularies.define: a strong feeling of dislike or disapproval
vocabularies.example: He looked at the mess with disgust.

vocabularies.define: a small fried cake of sweetened dough, typically in the shape of a ring
vocabularies.example: She bought a box of donuts for the office.

vocabularies.define: a person whose job is to open the door and assist people entering a building
vocabularies.example: The doorman greeted guests at the hotel entrance.

vocabularies.define: by means of electronic equipment or devices
vocabularies.example: You can submit the form electronically.

vocabularies.define: to lift up or raise to a higher position
vocabularies.example: She elevated her leg to reduce the swelling.

vocabularies.define: an arrangement to do something or go somewhere at a fixed time
vocabularies.example: He has a business engagement at 3 PM.

vocabularies.define: the act of registering or joining something
vocabularies.example: Enrollment in the course is now open.

vocabularies.define: the official currency of the eurozone
vocabularies.example: The price is 20 euros.

vocabularies.define: to order someone not to do something
vocabularies.example: Smoking is strictly forbidden here.

vocabularies.define: a tool with two or more prongs used for eating or serving food
vocabularies.example: She ate the salad with a fork.

vocabularies.define: to encourage or promote development
vocabularies.example: The program aims to foster creativity.

vocabularies.define: a short vacation
vocabularies.example: We planned a weekend getaway in Da Lat.

vocabularies.define: casual conversation about other people's private lives
vocabularies.example: She enjoys reading celebrity gossip.

vocabularies.define: a person who gains unauthorized access to data
vocabularies.example: The hacker broke into their computer system.

vocabularies.define: putting a lot of effort into work
vocabularies.example: She’s a hardworking student.

vocabularies.define: having no patience; easily annoyed by waiting
vocabularies.example: He gets impatient when things move slowly.

vocabularies.define: not direct or straightforward
vocabularies.example: She gave an indirect answer to the question.

vocabularies.define: someone who translates spoken language
vocabularies.example: They hired an interpreter for the meeting.

vocabularies.define: a place where two or more roads meet
vocabularies.example: Turn left at the next intersection.

vocabularies.define: not related to the subject
vocabularies.example: That comment was irrelevant to the discussion.

vocabularies.define: denim pants typically worn casually
vocabularies.example: He wore a t-shirt and jeans.

vocabularies.define: the activity of reporting news
vocabularies.example: She studied journalism in university.

vocabularies.define: the printed heading at the top of a letter
vocabularies.vietnames: giấy có tiêu đề công ty
vocabularies.example: The invoice was printed on official letterhead.

vocabularies.define: a game in which two teams hit a ball over a net
vocabularies.example: They played volleyball on the beach.

vocabularies.define: a chair with wheels used by people who cannot walk
vocabularies.example: He needs a wheelchair to move around.

vocabularies.define: the person or people who; no matter who
vocabularies.example: Whoever finishes first wins a prize.

vocabularies.define: the soft hair from sheep used for making clothes
vocabularies.example: This scarf is made of pure wool.

vocabularies.define: a small line or fold in the skin or fabric
vocabularies.example: She has a few wrinkles around her eyes.

vocabularies.define: to accept or act in accordance with a rule, decision, or recommendation
vocabularies.example: You must abide by the rules of the game.

vocabularies.define: in a way that involves doing something; with action
vocabularies.example: She is actively involved in community service.

vocabularies.define: a medical condition that causes someone to become sick after eating, touching, or breathing something that is harmless to most people
vocabularies.example: He has a peanut allergy.

vocabularies.define: anxious or fearful that something bad or unpleasant will happen
vocabularies.example: She felt apprehensive about the exam.

vocabularies.define: relating to cars or other vehicles
vocabularies.example: He works in the automotive industry.

vocabularies.define: microscopic living organisms, usually one-celled, that can be found everywhere
vocabularies.example: Bacteria can cause infections.

vocabularies.define: to make something wider or more general
vocabularies.example: Traveling can broaden your horizons.

vocabularies.define: a glass part of an electric lamp, which gives light when electricity passes through it
vocabularies.example: I need to replace the light bulb.

vocabularies.define: a rule made by a company or society to control the actions of its members
vocabularies.example: The by-laws prohibit smoking in the building.

vocabularies.define: a person employed to rescue people who get into difficulty in a swimming pool or at the beach
vocabularies.example: The lifeguard saved a swimmer from drowning.

vocabularies.define: a device that allows a computer to connect to the internet
vocabularies.example: The modem stopped working after the power outage.

vocabularies.define: a structure built to honor a person or event
vocabularies.example: The Lincoln Memorial is a famous monument in Washington, D.C.

vocabularies.define: a small flying insect that bites and sucks blood
vocabularies.example: She was bitten by a mosquito while camping.

vocabularies.define: to compel legally or morally
vocabularies.example: The law obligates employers to pay a minimum wage.

vocabularies.define: to do something as a favor or because of a rule
vocabularies.example: I’m obliged to help my friends when they’re in trouble.

vocabularies.define: an event or incident
vocabularies.vietnames: sự việc, sự kiện xảy ra
vocabularies.example: Rain is a common occurrence in April.

vocabularies.define: working or ready to work
vocabularies.example: The elevator is now fully operational.

vocabularies.define: a period when a service is not available
vocabularies.vietnames: mất điện, gián đoạn dịch vụ
vocabularies.example: There was a power outage last night.

vocabularies.define: to fill beyond what is comfortable or safe
vocabularies.example: The concert hall was overcrowded with fans.

vocabularies.define: a person trained to assist lawyers
vocabularies.example: She works as a paralegal at a law firm.

vocabularies.define: not completely
vocabularies.example: The road was partially blocked by fallen trees.

vocabularies.define: a spicy vegetable or a ground spice made from dried peppercorns
vocabularies.example: He added black pepper to the soup.

vocabularies.define: in a way that lasts or remains unchanged indefinitely
vocabularies.example: The store closed permanently last year.

vocabularies.define: to turn over soil using a large farming tool or machine
vocabularies.example: Farmers plow their fields in spring.

vocabularies.define: a question, especially one expressing doubt
vocabularies.example: She raised a query about the report’s accuracy.

vocabularies.define: a track with rails on which trains run
vocabularies.example: The railway connects the two cities.

vocabularies.define: a waterproof coat worn in the rain
vocabularies.example: Don’t forget your raincoat — it’s going to rain!

vocabularies.define: to think about something again
vocabularies.example: You should reconsider your decision.

vocabularies.define: to change the design of something
vocabularies.example: They plan to redesign the company logo.

vocabularies.define: a practice for a performance
vocabularies.example: We have rehearsal every evening before the play.

vocabularies.define: the state of being free from tension and anxiety
vocabularies.example: She listens to music for relaxation.

vocabularies.define: the action of repeating something
vocabularies.example: Language learning requires a lot of repetition.

vocabularies.define: a quiet or secluded place for rest and relaxation
vocabularies.example: They spent the weekend at a mountain retreat.

vocabularies.define: a place where people go to have their hair or nails done
vocabularies.example: She owns a hair salon downtown.

vocabularies.define: a branch office located away from the main office
vocabularies.example: They opened a satellite office in Hanoi.

vocabularies.define: the natural features of a landscape
vocabularies.example: The scenery in Sapa is breathtaking.

vocabularies.define: a story or play appearing in regular installments
vocabularies.example: She follows a popular drama serial on TV.

vocabularies.define: to join or repair something with a needle and thread
vocabularies.example: She sewed a button on his shirt.

vocabularies.define: a simple drawing
vocabularies.example: He made a quick sketch of the scene.

vocabularies.define: to rise quickly and dramatically
vocabularies.example: The temperature soared to 40°C.

vocabularies.define: something that causes a response or reaction
vocabularies.example: Light is a stimulus for plants to grow.

vocabularies.define: a person who buys and sells stocks for others
vocabularies.vietnames: nhân viên môi giới chứng khoán
vocabularies.example: He works as a stockbroker in a finance firm.

vocabularies.define: a cloth used to cover a table
vocabularies.example: She spread a white tablecloth before dinner.

vocabularies.define: feeling a need to drink something
vocabularies.example: I’m really thirsty after jogging.

vocabularies.define: a sudden strong feeling of excitement
vocabularies.example: He felt a thrill when the plane took off.

vocabularies.define: a flat, usually square piece used for covering floors or walls
vocabularies.example: The bathroom floor is made of ceramic tiles.

vocabularies.define: personal care items used for grooming
vocabularies.vietnames: đồ dùng vệ sinh cá nhân
vocabularies.example: Don’t forget to pack your toiletries for the trip.

vocabularies.define: a symbol or word legally registered to represent a company
vocabularies.example: Nike’s swoosh is a well-known trademark.

vocabularies.define: relating to or found in the tropics
vocabularies.example: They went on vacation to a tropical island.

vocabularies.define: a large sea fish used as food
vocabularies.example: She made a sandwich with canned tuna.

vocabularies.define: not having a job
vocabularies.example: He’s been unemployed for three months.

vocabularies.define: to confirm or prove something is true or correct
vocabularies.example: Please validate your parking ticket at the machine.

vocabularies.define: a flavoring derived from orchids of the genus Vanilla
vocabularies.example: She ordered a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

vocabularies.define: the quality of being ready to do something
vocabularies.example: Her willingness to help others is admirable.

vocabularies.define: a small watch worn on the wrist
vocabularies.example: He looked at his wristwatch and hurried out.

vocabularies.define: to praise enthusiastically and publicly
vocabularies.example: The author's latest novel was acclaimed by critics worldwide.

vocabularies.define: a piece of furniture with shelves for storing books
vocabularies.example: She arranged her favorite novels neatly on the bookcase.

vocabularies.define: to shout approval or encouragement
vocabularies.example: The crowd cheered as the team scored the winning goal.

vocabularies.define: persisting for a long time or constantly recurring
vocabularies.example: He suffers from chronic back pain.

vocabularies.define: the state or quality of being clean
vocabularies.example: Regular handwashing is essential for personal cleanliness.

vocabularies.define: a circumstance that complicates something; a difficulty
vocabularies.example: The surgery went well, but there was a minor complication during recovery.

vocabularies.define: careful not to cause inconvenience or hurt to others
vocabularies.example: She is always considerate of her neighbors' needs.

vocabularies.define: a person who takes part in a contest or competition
vocabularies.example: Each contestant had to answer ten questions in the quiz show.

vocabularies.define: the time of the day between sunrise and sunset
vocabularies.example: She prefers to work during the daytime.

vocabularies.define: the process or art of decorating something
vocabularies.example: The hall was filled with beautiful decorations for the wedding.

vocabularies.define: to become worse in quality or condition
vocabularies.example: Her health deteriorated rapidly after the accident.

vocabularies.define: to throw something away or get rid of it because you no longer want or need it
vocabularies.example: He discarded the old newspapers stacked in the corner.

vocabularies.define: in a way that is severe and sudden or has very noticeable effects
vocabularies.vietnames: một cách mạnh mẽ, quyết liệt
vocabularies.example: The company has drastically reduced its prices.

vocabularies.define: to remove something completely, especially something written or recorded
vocabularies.example: She erased the chalkboard after the lesson.

vocabularies.define: moral principles that govern a person's behavior or the conducting of an activity
vocabularies.example: Business ethics are important in corporate governance.

vocabularies.define: a person who travels to unknown places to discover new things
vocabularies.example: The explorer ventured into the uncharted jungle.

vocabularies.define: concerned with what is actually the case; based on facts
vocabularies.vietnames: thực tế, dựa trên sự thật
vocabularies.example: The article provided a factual account of the events.

vocabularies.define: a piece of equipment or furniture that is fixed in position in a building or vehicle
vocabularies.example: The light fixtures were installed last week.

vocabularies.define: things that people wear on their feet, such as shoes or boots
vocabularies.example: Proper footwear is essential for hiking.

vocabularies.define: a category of artistic composition, as in music or literature, characterized by similarities in form, style, or subject matter
vocabularies.example: She enjoys reading books in the fantasy genre.

vocabularies.define: a large room or building equipped for physical exercise
vocabularies.example: Students have PE classes in the gymnasium.

vocabularies.define: having or showing good health; promoting good health
vocabularies.vietnames: lành mạnh, tốt cho sức khỏe
vocabularies.example: A healthful diet includes fruits and vegetables.

vocabularies.define: as a result of this statement or action
vocabularies.example: I hereby declare the meeting open.

vocabularies.define: the act of pausing before doing something, often because of uncertainty
vocabularies.example: After a moment’s hesitation, she agreed to the proposal.

vocabularies.define: made at home, not bought from a shop
vocabularies.example: She brought homemade cookies to the party.

vocabularies.define: the friendly and generous reception of guests, visitors, or strangers
vocabularies.example: We were deeply impressed by the hospitality of the locals.

vocabularies.define: arriving at or coming to a place or position
vocabularies.example: He checked his incoming emails before the meeting.

vocabularies.define: the process of introducing someone to a new job or organization
vocabularies.vietnames: sự giới thiệu, sự cảm ứng
vocabularies.example: New staff members will attend an induction session.

vocabularies.define: not achieving maximum productivity; wasting time or resources
vocabularies.example: The current system is inefficient and needs updating.

vocabularies.define: a person or thing that motivates or stimulates creativity
vocabularies.example: The artist found inspiration in nature.

vocabularies.define: with earnest and eager attention
vocabularies.example: She listened intently to the speaker.

vocabularies.define: a metric unit of capacity, equal to 1,000 cubic centimeters
vocabularies.example: He drank a liter of water after the workout.

vocabularies.define: a machine used to cut grass
vocabularies.example: The mower is kept in the garage.

vocabularies.define: the process of obtaining the food necessary for health and growth
vocabularies.example: Good nutrition is essential for children’s development.

vocabularies.define: a period of temporary economic decline
vocabularies.example: The country is experiencing a severe recession.

vocabularies.define: to be similar or look like
vocabularies.example: She closely resembles her mother.

vocabularies.define: the act of expressing something again in a different way
vocabularies.example: The lawyer made a restatement of the facts.

vocabularies.define: a car that has four doors and a separate trunk
vocabularies.example: He bought a new black sedan last month.

vocabularies.define: a cream or lotion used to protect the skin from sunburn
vocabularies.example: Don't forget to apply sunscreen before going out.

vocabularies.define: a representation of events in chronological order
vocabularies.example: The project timeline spans six months.

vocabularies.define: not having official permission or approval
vocabularies.example: Unauthorized access to the building is prohibited.

vocabularies.define: to remove a plug from a socket
vocabularies.example: Don’t forget to unplug the charger.

vocabularies.define: not able to be trusted or depended on
vocabularies.example: He is unreliable when it comes to meeting deadlines.

vocabularies.define: a meeting held over the internet using video technology
vocabularies.example: We have a video conference with the team in Japan.

vocabularies.define: to break or act against something, especially a law or rule
vocabularies.example: They were punished for violating the company policy.

vocabularies.define: the state of being in good health
vocabularies.example: The company offers a wellness program for employees.

vocabularies.define: a book containing problems and exercises that a student can work on
vocabularies.example: The teacher asked us to complete pages 20–25 in our workbook.
